meanings.definition: To scatter bait in the water to attract fish.
meanings.sent1: While fishing, we tried chumming the water to lure in more fish.
meanings.sent2: Fishermen often use chumming to attract different types of fish.
meanings.sent3: The fish laughed at the chumming attempt, thinking they were too smart to fall for it.
meanings.sent4: The chumming of bait created a feeding frenzy among the fish.
meanings.sent5: Chumming the water with bits of food made the fish swarm around the boat.

meanings.sent1: My best friend is not just a chumming but also a great listener.
meanings.sent2: Having a loyal chumming can make life more enjoyable.
meanings.sent3: I always rely on my chumming to share good times and bad jokes.
meanings.sent4: She is like a ray of sunshine, my chumming in times of darkness.
meanings.sent5: A true chumming is someone who sticks by your side through thick and thin.
